newsitem.title: USA: Founder of Chile's Santa Isabel to sell stake.
newsitem.headline: Founder of Chile's Santa Isabel to sell stake.

text.p: Chilean supermarket chain Santa Isabel said Thursday its founder and chairman plans to sell his stake in the company for about $230 million.

The chain, whose stock is traded on the New York Stock Exchange, said Eduardo Elberg plans to sell his 36.96 percent stake to The Velox Group, which holds a controlling interest in the Argentinian supermarket chain Disco SA.
"The definitive terms of the purchase are expected to be finalised in the next 10 days," it said in a statement.
Santa Isabel said it has begun talks of its own with Velox to form a "strategic alliance" to share industry knowledge such as logistics and marketing and improve their long-term competitive position.
The companies would remain separate, with their own management and corporate structures in place, it added.
Santa Isabel, based in Valparaiso, Chile, also said it is still looking to form a joint venture with an international hypermarket operator to help it develop its own warehouse superstore format.
Santa Isabel's stock rose $1.75 to $26.375 on the New York Stock Exchange at midday.
